sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Phyala lachrymarum. Or A few friendly teares, shed over the dead body of Mr Nathaniel Weld Mr of Arts of Emanuel Colledge in Cambridge who in the short journey of his life, died betwene the five and sixe and twentieth yeare of his youth, 1633. Together with sundry choyce meditations of mortalitie. Lathum, William.
[12], 47, [1] p.
Printed by R. Y[oung] for George Lathum at the signe of the Bishops head in Pauls Churchyard, London : Anno 1634.
Dedication signed: W. Lathum. In verse. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-B¹² C⁶. The first leaf is blank. "Meditationes quædam de amicitia, de vitæ fragilitate, de morte, et de anima" has separate dated title page; register and pagination are continuous. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Or A few friendly teares, shed over the dead body of Mr Nathaniel Weld Mr of Arts of Emanuel Colledge in Cambridge who in the short journey of his life, died betwene the five and sixe and twentieth yeare of his youth, 1633. Together with sundry choyce meditations of mortalitie. Lathum, William.
[12], 47, [1] p.
Printed by R. Y[oung] for George Lathum at the signe of the Bishops head in Pauls Churchyard, London : Anno 1634.
Dedication signed: W. Lathum. In verse. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-B¹² C⁶. The first leaf is blank. "Meditationes quædam de amicitia, de vitæ fragilitate, de morte, et de anima" has separate dated title page; register and pagination are continuous.
